Like earning the Audible trophy‚Äôs within the app and I‚Äôm sure the team at Audible like earning rating Stars for this app. Audible will earn another two stars (from me) when they publish some of the works of the mighty Mr Michener. I‚Äôm all ears. I hope someone‚Äôs listening as well :)

Audible.title: An intelligent look at the post capitalist world order
Audible.body: The books reads as a retrospective look at the evolution of capitalism and as a letter to the dreams and visions of Yanis‚Äôs father. A deep dive and collective view of the future of capitalism re written by the cloudalist, argues that China and America basically own the future. The new rent seekers are the technology companies in earnest now realistically control much of the way societies think and interact as well as the way global finance interacts with consumers and businesses. A great critique of the promise of blockchain and digital coins and how they were usurped by con artists and the dream of decentralisation way just a parting dream. It‚Äôs a sorrow tale for left who dreamed of a post capitalist rebirth of the socialist system. That is dead the power now more than ever resides in the hands of tech bros and fewer nation states to set the rule of the future. I appreciate that he gives a remedy to this at the end, with a independent revolutionary concept, worth exploring, the conditioning of all us will be at war with the desire for change someday I hope. A great contribution to a topic not really discussed today and one I hope sees other expand on.

Audible.title: One of my Top 3 Apps- BUT...
Audible.body: I love my Audible App & use it daily. There really is something incredibly special & satisfying about hearing your favourite stories brought to vivid life by a talented narrator. My job involves spending all day looking at a computer screen so my eyes struggle to cope with the added strain of reading on top of work- my audible app means I can still emerge myself in so many of the literary worlds I love.My ONE complaint? Since the last 2-3 versions have been released, sometimes I can‚Äôt get newly purchased books to download. REALLY annoying. Most of the time (90-95%) I just wait a day or so & the problem fixes itself. Once or twice now I‚Äôve had to delete the App, shut down my phone & then RE-install the App again once I‚Äôve turned my iPhone back on. This seems to be a recurring theme in a lot of the most recent reviews- wish they would fix whatever bug it is, because otherwise this App is the best thing to happen to my ability to keep reading for enjoyment in a long, long time!

Audible.title: Great but some tweaks required
Audible.body: 1) Need an option to stop seeing certain books. I will never buy a book from Michelle Obama, Will Smith, or Prince Harry so please give me an option to say not interested and for these to no longer be displayed.  2) Daily deals are great and I have bought a bunch however they are more often than not completely irrelevant. Given the large number of books on Audible there are bound to be more customised options available  3) I am often interested in series which are very old like Clive Cusslers Dirk Pitt, Wilbur Smith‚Äôs Courtney‚Äôs, Tom Clancy‚Äôs Jack Ryan‚Äôs. All of these titles cost the same as a new book even though many are decades old and no longer on the best sellers list. I, and many others, would be tempted to buy whole series at a discount or buy one at full price and the rest 50% off, or 2 for a credit.4) Last but not least. I am not one bit interested in LGBT or Australian Aboriginal literature. Many of my favourite books have characters or content which deals with these however it is not front and centre. How Audible pushes books with a pure focus on this content on their clients I find frustrating and reprehensible. Your role is to provide compelling content to all of your clients not force fringe content, relevant to a few, on everyone in an transparent effort to appear progressive and righteous.

Audible.title: AMAZING
Audible.body: This app is used 24/7 by me, as someone who can‚Äôt just fall asleep with silence, I need something to listen to, and for me trying new podcasts are always so hard because I am so used to the other ones that I listen to. But when I first found a book to listen to, I thought that it was like amazing I was like I actually like this, and that‚Äôs weird for me because I don‚Äôt normally like new things I don‚Äôt really like change so that was actually a really good thing to discover because now I can try new books whenever I get sick of one book then I can go and listen to another podcast or another book. Although I would say sometimes when I‚Äôm trying to skip or back it doesn‚Äôt let me so that‚Äôs one downside but otherwise this app is amazing. Another thing to mention is that if you want to get a monthly ticket or credit to use for a book or podcast you should do it. It‚Äôs quite cheap and it actually works and it‚Äôs actually pretty good to do because it some of the books that are already free on Audible they don‚Äôt normally they aren‚Äôt that good in my opinion so I would suggest highly buying the monthly credit thing.

Audible.title: Tuesday with Maurie
Audible.body: I really enjoy to listening to this and I have read the book and I am not really a person that reads so the aublile books and podcasts are really good for me l have listened to several autobiography and enjoy them some better than others and I always seem to have a break from them and then I go back to them that is just a personal thing listening to Tuesday with Maurie and I watch the film was something a friend got she was only in forties it‚Äôs a horrible disease and watching some one go through it is hard to watch how it effects them I found I could relate with some of the ways as it was just like the things my friend went through let‚Äôs hope some day a will find a way that it will prolong a person‚Äôs life as I don‚Äôt know if they will ever find a cure well not in my life time but once upon a time you rarely heard of it but  now you see more people with it and I can relate when I see them as I watched my friend fight the disease and eventually losing the battle with it

Audible.title: A relatable life story
Audible.body: Selma Blair, you have such a relatable story to so many women of my generation and (I‚Äôm sure) for every generation before and to follow. I saw myself in you in so many ways‚Ä¶ childhood innocence, navigating teenagerdom, the vulnerabilty, relationships and all the lessons that come with it all. Highlighting to us all that we never stop learning and relearning throughout our lives. As an actor who has grown up parallel to me, I never realised that you were actually growing up in front us all, experiencing such similar anxieties, anguishes and adversities that we all face.You have emerged like a butterfly with such grace and composure‚Ä¶ The message I have taken away from your story is to keep going and keep growing and learning, despite what is thrown at us in this crazy old world.The best part about listening to your story on Audible is that YOU told the story to me‚Ä¶ straight from the horses mouth. With all of the raw emotion, laughter and tears. Thank you, and please keep writing‚Ä¶ it really is your true calling. üôè‚ù§Ô∏è

Audible.title: Everyone must read this book
Audible.body: This book changed my life. Bessel gave me so much hope as a trauma sufferer also dealing with addiction and mental health issues. He shared a variety of proven and successful avenues for healing trauma outside of western medicine practices. The psychiatric industry has been failing us greatly and is keeping us sick and at risk. This book gives us agency by providing so many solution based approaches which are holistic and gentle on our bodies and minds. Rather than provide Band-Aid solutions which never deal with the issues at hand he provided insight into how to address the cause of our suffering by leaning in and provided strategic approaches to taking our healing into our own hands no matter where we are in our lives. This has lead me down a new healing journey after years of searching and has given me so much inspiration into new ways of. healing myself in more effective ways that promote growth rather than quash who I am with medications that don‚Äôt work.

Audible.title: More credits
Audible.body: I have been using audible for nearly a year now and I can say it has without a doubt opened my mind up to another universe that I hadn‚Äôt known about til now, I highly recommend it to anyone who loves books but either doesn‚Äôt have the time to physically read them or even has issues concentrating on reading print like myself. This app has changed my life I recommend it to all of my friends regularly and with the subscription you get a new book each month. One suggestion I would have for the makers is possibly adding an option to buy credits in bulk for cheaper prices, sometimes I want to read a new series of books but find myself not wanting to waste credits/$15 on books between 5-10 hours as I can finish that in a day or so, if I had the option to buy more in one go I wouldn‚Äôt find myself skipping series that have shorter books at the beginning. Aside from that it‚Äôs basically flawless in my eyes, keep up the good work guys!

Audible.title: Wish there was a percentage number
Audible.body: I adore Audible, it‚Äôs kinda expensive but the selection is unprecedented. It‚Äôs so great for encouraging more reading, as you can multitask while consuming a story. I love how there is brand new and popular books on here, and you also don‚Äôt have to wait like you might on Libby. In terms of the app, I wish you could purchase through the app. I wish that you could change the timer to view the percentage you were through the book, and that the overall progress timer was visible on books that were loaded in 2 parts. Finally, I wish that there were cost effective subscriptions for multiple books per month as I read maybe 2 audiobooks a week and find that Audible gets expensive so I rotate between this, Libby (which is connected to your library card, meaning that it‚Äôs free BUT they will only have a certain amount of copies of a book and you need to wait until a copy is available - like a normal library book - which can be loooong with new or popular books but has a STUNNING app interface that I believe is more intuitive than Audible), and less frequently I‚Äôll listen to Scribd but the selection is average compared to either of the first two I choose and the app isn‚Äôt as pleasant as even Audible. Overall, I love Audible because of the range and I would keep it purely based off of that however I also enjoy the interface and the experience of the books. Overall, I

Audible.title: Good service, Bad support
Audible.body: Audible was reasonably good while I was using it though some would argue a bit on the pricey side. It‚Äôs a good service if you can‚Äôt find time to read yourself or just need to relax and listen to a book. If you try and cancel the service, boy are you in for a rough ride. For a start you can‚Äôt do this via the mobile app and have to go through their website. When you do eventually find the section and go through with it, there are no guarantees that you won‚Äôt continue to be billed. I cancelled and despite my membership saying it‚Äôs not active now as well as a confirmation email I was still charged at the end of the following month. Cancelled 21st Feb, membership officially ended on the 3rd of March I believe and then charged again on the 31st. You go through their first call option which is some sort of online call (after fighting disheartened through more roundabouts of help options) and the call just cancels after a few minutes of waiting, repeatedly. Try the toll free number and well guess what, it says it is not currently active!!! Classic scam warning signs but Audible isn‚Äôt a scam. I cancelled cause I don‚Äôt have a job now but I‚Äôm waiting to see whether some of my food money will disappear at the end of this month if I get charged again. Not happy!!

Audible.title: Life by Keith Richards
Audible.body: The hilarious opening chapter sets the feel and themes of what‚Äôs to follow and left me shaking my head incredulously. Keith can clearly spin a great yarn. Rich descriptions of his childhood in Dartford, detailed a seeming no man‚Äôs land of post war Britain trying to find its way from the old to the new. Keith‚Äôs guiding lights were the Chicago blues artists, who faded in and faded out across the Atlantic airways through the antennae of his transistor radio. Together with the influence of his musical family, and a chance meeting with Mick Jagger (who lived in a posher part of town) a partnership was forged that became the Rolling Stones. Keith rambles at times, yet he rambles with a fierce hearted loyalty and insight into the populace of musicians, women, staff and personalities, who came and went from his life; some of whom who also shaped the face of the sixties and seventies. It‚Äôs a gripping tale. I loved hearing Keith speak himself - such a rich, gravelly and warm voice - a welcome relief from the monotony of Depp‚Äôs narration and the south London accented overkill of the second narrator.

Audible.title: A fantastic non-behavioralist, social justice parenting book
Audible.body: Parenting Beyond Power is awesome! If you are looking for ways to ‚Äòbe the change you want to see in the world‚Äô and ‚Äòtreat others the way you would like to be treated‚Äô here is an great parenting manual for finding ways to do just that, starting in your home.This audiobook brings together the key elements of NVC, collaborative problem solving, unconditional parenting and social justice parenting in a beautifully presented, easy to understand way.I recommend this book to every parent, it truly has something to offer everyone. If you wish to parent differently to how you were parented, this book will help you tread your own path. If you were parented in a respectful way that aligns with your values this book will provide insight into why it can STILL be hard to let go of 'power over' parenting in times of stress. If you currently parent in an authoritarian way this book provides solid research based reasons to consider the alternatives. Even if you read this book and find it is not for you, it will certainly provide food for thought.I found the content that spoke directly to healing damaging patriarchal, capitalist and racist systems (insidious in W.E.I.R.D. societies) super beneficial. I will refer back to this book whenever I perceive a potential disconnect between my parenting and my values.I can‚Äôt wait for a book number 2!

Audible.title: Beware citizens of the world
Audible.body: History repeats and I feel the world is yet again facing a perilous onslaught of dangerous far left agendas all converging at once. Cancel culture and woke culture are amongst a variety of groups that have sinister groups backing them. How spoiled are the youth of today, a generation who have never had it so good, yet complain about how unfair life is and how unjust things can be. I say grow up and give thanks to those who walked before you that had something to actually complain about, where injustice was real. This book lays out in broad daylight how tyrannical govt can be and how easy it is to wake up and it‚Äôs... too late. Smarten up as this book should be a reminder to never get complacent. I appreciate you making this available and hope all of humanity get the opportunity to read it. With thanks and appreciation.

Audible.title: Complete rubbish
Audible.body: I guess I shouldn‚Äôt have had such high expectations but really you would think that by 2022 you could be excused for thinking that apps should just work. This has to be the worst app I‚Äôve ever downloaded. Why can‚Äôt you use credits to purchase in app? Why can‚Äôt you purchase credits in app? Why is there no link to purchase from search? Why do items I have finally figured out how to purchase say they‚Äôve gone to my library but don‚Äôt show in my library in app? Why does the player freeze? If you‚Äôve ever been worried about being ripped off through an app then don‚Äôt use this one! The selection of books cannot be beaten but this app is simply useless. I hope the designers have been arrested tied up and receive a sound thrashing every day for the pain they have inflicted on so many. Absolute asscrack. You even get forced to give a one star review even if you want to give none. Don‚Äôt use this rubbish!

Audible.title: ALL BLACKS Passion in WORDS
Audible.body: Thanks so much to all who endeavoured to put All Black history into such a magnificent book. I was genuinely sad to reach the end. Having moved to NZ from Canada in 2007, I first fell in love with the game watching them play SA in a little pub in Ohakune where so many fans packed the room, it felt like when Canada played Russia in ice hockey. It was there that I first saw grown men fly through the air to victory. I watched sportsmanship that saw the foulest call by a ref, not even register distain on Richie McCaw‚Äôs face because he was already getting in position for the next play. There was a physicality to the game but there more skill than I‚Äôd ever seen on field of any other game. This book puts into words the journey we all took while Sir Steve Hansen was at the helm. It will always be topical for the game and whether you played or are a fan, you will find it FASCINATING!!!

Audible.title: Essential reading to get understanding.
Audible.body: This my third listen to this narration in the last two months. What Mike reveals is too much too absorb in just one reading just as much as Scripture itself. We can never exhaust the depths of The Word our Heavenly Father has given us it is a lifelong study we dare not undertake. Only scholars like  Mike can open up the depths of Revelation in the language of The Word. He was a man raised up and empowered to bring to us who are willing to make effort Mike has lifted my understanding a 1000fold in this year alone. I am 82n years old and still willing to be taught, and our Heavenly Father is enabling me to learn despite my poor education and limited skills. Please i exhort all who seek to know absolute truth do read this book and meg the God of all Creation bless you with understanding as He has me. üôè Rob in New Zealand

Audible.title: Audible
Audible.body: Fantastic app, I found concentrating in reading very difficult after a major illness and then discovered audible. I credit this site with helping me on the road to recovery as I was no longer bored. Now I am well I can read on the car, getting ready to go out, even before I sleep. Put on the timer either minutes then off to sleep. Can download anywhere , anytime. Always have your library with you. Still the best app. Have been using audible for 5 years. Excellent plus they do listen to us and improve the app. A year later and still the best app.A fee more years of using Audible. I paint in my spare time and find listening to books and painting are the best companions. It is great to do two things I love at the same time. Keep up the good work. üòÄüòÄüíú

Audible.title: Good content, very marginal access to it
Audible.body: I have recently just trialled audible, found a book series I enjoyed listening to. However after finishing the book, and deciding I will happily pay for the next in the series. I discovered that I have no ability at all to buy more credits or anything outside of the 1 book a month. From my perspective my first months use has dried up in a matter of days and the apps inability to allow me to purchase additional books, means that audible from my experience, is largely redundant for most of the monthly duration. I‚Äôm not talking about wanting more for my money, simply the ability to spend more of my money in order to continue with a series I enjoyed, seems counter productive to a business, to restrict and limit you ability to spend money in their products or services.
